Contact the mayor or city councilmembers

Tumwater City Councilmembers do not have offices at City Hall. You may email the mayor, council, and city administrator by sending one email or leave a message by telephone at 360-754-4120. You may also send written correspondence to:

Tumwater City Hall Attn: Mayor's Office 555 Israel Road SW Tumwater, WA  98501

Please note, all city communications are considered public records.
Council Meetings
Council meets twice each month, unless otherwise noticed, on the first and third Tuesday at 7 p.m. Meetings are held in the Council Chambers at City Hall .  In addition, council meets on the second and fourth Tuesday at 6 p.m. in the Fire Department Headquarters Training Room for an informal Work Session .
Proclamation Requests
Requests for mayoral proclamations and other ceremonial documents shall be submitted to the Office of the Mayor for consideration. Proclamation sponsors should provide their request to the mayor along with a draft proclamation for consideration at least 30 days in advance of the event by email, or by mail to: City of Tumwater Mayor’s Office 555 Israel Road SW Tumwater, WA 98501
  • Only one proclamation will be issued per year, per organization. Each renewal request will be considered on a case-by-case basis.
  • Proposals which promote a position on a pending ballot or legislative issue will not be considered. Pending ballot or legislative issues must be prepared by a council resolution sponsored by a member of the city council following procedures specified in State Public Disclosure Law.

Submission of a proclamation request does not guarantee issuance. Ultimately, the proclamation is issued by the mayor and the mayor reserves the right to reject or modify a proclamation in any way.

Contact the city clerk by email or call 360-754-4120.
